question: Which country houses the Vikos–Aoos National Park?
explanation: The Vikos–Aoos National Park is an IUCN category II national park in the region of Epirus in northwestern Greece. The park, founded in 1973, is one of ten national parks in mainland Greece and is located in the northern part of the Pindus mountain range. It is named after the two major gorges of the area and encompasses mountainous terrain, with numerous rivers, lakes, caves, deep canyons, dense coniferous and deciduous forest. The park is part of the Natura 2000 ecological network and one of UNESCO Geoparks.
